segments.text: It has just occurred to me that there is still another possibility to ensure a prompt delivery of the goods .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: How about making Hong Kong the port of shipment instead of New York ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I'm afraid we can't agree to that . We concluded the business with you here in Houston , and the goods you ordered are manufactured in New York . We wish to point out that all orders accepted by us are shipped from New York or Seattle . Hong Kong is out of the question .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: It's like this . There are only one or two ships sailing a month from New York to Osaka , while sailings from Hong Kong are quite frequent . If shipment were effected from Hong Kong , we could receive the goods much earlier .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I see . You want to have your goods shipped from New York to Osaka via Hong Kong , where they can be transshipped . Is that the idea ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Yes , exactly , because I want these goods on our market at the earliest possible date .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Your idea may be a good one , but the trouble is that there are risks of pilferage or damage to the goods during transshipment at Hong Kong . How about shipping them from Seattle instead of network ? You may choose either one as port of shipment . It makes no difference to us . There are more sailings from Seattle than from New York .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: It sounds all right to me , but I will have to think about it . I'll give you a definite answer tomorrow . If I choose Seattle , will it be possible for you to ship the goods by the end of March ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: We'll try our best . Anyway , we assure you that shipment will be made not later than the first half of April .
segments.speaker: S2
